higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

name: Swift Quiver
components: V, S, M (a quiver containing at least one piece of ammunition)
description: You transmute your quiver so it produces an endless supply of nonmagical ammunition, which seems to leap into your hand. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to make two attacks with a weapon that uses ammunition from the quiver. Each time you make such an attack, your quiver replaces the piece of ammunition. Any pieces created by this spell disintegrate when the spell ends.

name: Synaptic Static
description: You cause psychic energy to explode at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere must make an Intelligence saving throw; creatures with Intelligence 2 or lower are unaffected. A target takes 8d6 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. On a failed save, a target's thoughts are muddled for 1 minute; it must roll a d6 and subtract the number from its attack rolls, ability checks, and Concentration saves.

name: Telekinesis
description: You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought. On each of your turns as an action, you can exert your will on one creature or object within range. If targeting a creature, you must make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by its Strength check to move it up to 30 feet or restrain it. You can also move objects weighing up to 1,000 pounds or exert fine control on them.

name: Teleportation Circle
components: V, M (rare chalks and inks infused with precious gems worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You draw a 10-foot-diameter circle on the ground inscribed with sigils that link your location to a permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know. A shimmering portal opens and remains open until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the portal instantly appears within 5 feet of the destination circle. You can make a circle permanent by casting this spell in the same location every day for one year.

name: Transmute Rock
description: You choose an area of stone or mud that fits within a 40-foot cube and choose one of two effects. Transmute Rock to Mud: Nonmagical rock becomes thick, flowing mud. Creatures on the ground must make a Strength saving throw or sink and be restrained. Transmute Mud to Rock: Nonmagical mud turns to stone. Creatures in the mud must make a Strength saving throw or be restrained; if they fail the save, they are instead trapped in the rock.

name: Tree Stride
description: You gain the ability to enter a living tree and move from inside it to inside another tree of the same kind within 500 feet. Both trees must be at least the same size as you. You must use 5 feet of movement to enter a tree. You can use this transportation ability once per round. You must end each turn outside a tree.

name: Wall of Force
components: V, S, M (a pinch of powder made by crushing a clear gemstone)
description: An invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose. The wall can be a hemispherical dome or sphere with a 10-foot radius, or a flat surface of ten 10-foot-square panels. The wall is 1/4 inch thick and lasts for the duration. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled, though it is destroyed by the disintegrate spell. It also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking travel there.

name: Wall of Light
description: A shimmering wall of bright light appears. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. It blocks line of sight but creatures can pass through it. When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a Constitution saving throw or take 4d8 radiant damage and be blinded for 1 minute. As an action, you can launch a 4d8 radiant damage beam from the wall, reducing its length by 10 feet each time.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Wall of Stone
components: V, S, M (a small block of granite)
description: A nonmagical wall of solid stone springs into existence. The wall is 6 inches thick and composed of ten 10-foot-square panels. If you maintain concentration for the whole duration, the wall becomes permanent. Each panel has AC 15 and 30 hit points per inch of thickness. The wall must merge with and be supported by existing stone.

name: Wrath of Nature
description: You call out to the spirits of nature to rouse them against your enemies in a 60-foot cube you can see. Effects vary by terrain feature: Grass and undergrowth make the area difficult terrain and can restrain creatures. Trees can lash out at creatures. Roots and vines can trip foes. Rocks can be launched at creatures within the area to deal 3d8 bludgeoning damage.

name: Arcane Gate
description: You create linked teleportation portals that remain open for the duration. Choose two points on the ground that you can see, one within 10 feet of you and one within 500 feet of you. A circular portal, 10 feet in diameter, opens over each point. The portals are two-dimensional glowing rings; anything entering one portal travels to the other as if they were adjacent.

name: Blade Barrier
description: You create a vertical wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter. The wall provides three-quarters cover and its space is difficult terrain. A creature that enters the area or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d10 slashing damage on a failure.

name: Bones of the Earth
description: You cause up to six pillars of stone to burst from the ground you can see within range. Each pillar is 5 feet in diameter and up to 30 feet high. If a pillar is created under a creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity save or be lifted. If a pillar is stopped by a ceiling, a creature on it takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is restrained. Each pillar has AC 5 and 30 hit points.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can create two additional pillars for each slot level above 6th.

name: Chain Lightning
components: V, S, M (a bit of fur; a piece of amber, glass, or a crystal rod; and three silver pins)
description: You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional bolt leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

name: Circle of Death
components: V, S, M (the powder of a crushed black pearl worth at least 500 gp)
description: A sphere of negative energy ripples out in a 60-foot-radius sphere from a point within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Conjure Fey
description: You summon a fey creature of challenge rating 6 or lower, or a fey spirit that takes the form of a beast of challenge rating 6 or lower. It appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The fey creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The fey creature is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. If your concentration is broken, the fey creature doesn't disappear; instead, it becomes hostile and might attack you.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Contingency
components: V, S, M (a statuette of yourself carved from ivory and decorated with gems worth at least 1,500 gp)
description: Choose a spell of 5th level or lower that you can cast, that has a casting time of 1 action, and that can target you. You cast that spellâ€”called the contingent spellâ€”as part of casting contingency, expending spell slots for both, but the contingent spell doesn't come into effect. Instead, it takes effect when a certain circumstance occurs, which you describe when you cast the two spells. The contingency ends early if you cast it again or if the components are no longer on your person.

name: Create Homunculus
components: V, S, M (clay, ash, and mandrake root, all consumed, and a jewel-encrusted dagger worth at least 1,000 gp)
description: While speaking an intricate incantation, you cut yourself with a jewel-encrusted dagger, taking 2d4 piercing damage that can't be reduced. You then drip your blood on the other components and touch them, transforming them into a special construct called a homunculus that is an extension of yourself and shares your thoughts. You can have only one homunculus at a time.

name: Create Undead
components: V, S, M (one clay pot filled with grave dirt, one filled with brackish water, and one 150 gp black onyx stone for each corpse)
description: You can cast this spell only at night. Choose up to three corpses of Medium or Small humanoids within range. Each corpse becomes a ghoul under your control. As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you. The creature is under your control for 24 hours. To maintain control for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current period ends.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a 7th-level spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over four ghouls. At 8th-level, you can create five ghouls or two ghasts or wights. At 9th-level, you can create six ghouls, three ghasts or wights, or two mummies.

name: Disintegrate
components: V, S, M (a lodestone and a pinch of dust)
description: A thin green ray springs from your finger to a target you can see. A creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 10d6 + 40 force damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated into a pile of fine gray dust. The spell automatically disintegrates a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. A magic item is unaffected.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 3d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Drawmij's Instant Summons
components: V, S, M (a sapphire worth 1,000 gp)
description: You touch an object weighing 10 pounds or less. The spell leaves an invisible mark and inscribes the name of the item on the sapphire. At any time thereafter, you can use your action to speak the item's name and crush the sapphire. The item instantly appears in your hand regardless of physical or planar distances. If another creature is holding the item, crushing the sapphire reveals who that creature is and roughly where they are located.

name: Druid Grove
components: V, S, M (mistletoe, consumed, harvested with a golden sickle under a full moon)
description: You protect an area outdoors or underground (30-foot to 90-foot cube). Buildings are excluded. If cast in the same area every day for a year, it lasts until dispelled. Effects include: solid fog that heavily obscures the area and hampers movement; grasping vines and undergrowth that can restrain creatures; and your choice of one additional effect (Gust of Wind, Spike Growth, or Wind Wall).

name: Eyebite
description: For the duration, your eyes become an inky void. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice: Asleep (unconscious for 1 minute), Panicked (frightened and must use Dash to move away), or Sickened (poisoned). As an action on each of your subsequent turns, you can use this ability on a new creature.

name: Find the Path
components: V, S, M (a set of divinatory tools worth 100 gp and an object from the location)
description: This spell allows you to find the shortest, most direct physical route to a specific fixed location that you are familiar with on the same plane of existence. While the spell is active, you know the direction and distance to the destination. If you are ever faced with a choice of paths, the spell indicates which one is the shortest and most direct.

name: Fizban's Platinum Shield
components: V, S, M (a platinum-plated dragon scale worth at least 500 gp)
description: You create a field of silvery light around a creature. It grants: Resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage; the Evasion trait; and Half Cover (+2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saves). As a bonus action on your turns, you can move the field to a different creature within range.

name: Flesh to Stone
components: V, S, M (a pinch of lime, water, and earth)
description: You attempt to turn one creature of flesh into stone. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is restrained as its flesh hardens. It must repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. If it fails three saves, it is petrified for the duration. If it succeeds on three saves, the spell ends. If you maintain concentration for the full minute, the petrification lasts until removed.

name: Forbiddance
components: V, S, M (holy water, incense, and powdered ruby worth at least 1,000 gp)
description: You create a ward against magical travel in an area up to 40,000 square feet. For the duration, creatures can't teleport into the area or use portals to enter. The area is proofed against planar travel. Additionally, you choose one or more creature types (celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead) that take 5d10 radiant or necrotic damage when they enter the area or start their turn there. If cast every day for 30 days in the same spot, it lasts until dispelled.

name: Globe of Invulnerability
components: V, S, M (a glass or crystal bead that shatters when the spell ends)
description: An immobile, shimmering barrier surrounds you. Spells of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher-level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the barrier blocks spells of one level higher for each slot level above 6th.

name: Guards and Wards
components: V, S, M (incense, brimstone, oil, a knotted string, umber hulk blood, and a silver rod worth 10 gp)
description: You ward a large structure (up to 2,500 sq ft). Effects include: fog filling corridors; magically locked doors; webs in stairs; and one extra effect (Dancing Lights, Magic Mouth, Stinking Cloud, Gust of Wind, or Suggestion). If cast in the same spot every day for a year, it becomes permanent.

name: Harm
description: You unleash a virulent disease. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 14d6 necrotic damage (half on success). The damage can't reduce the target below 1 hit point. If the save is failed, the target's hit point maximum is also reduced for 1 hour by the amount of necrotic damage taken.

name: Heal
description: A surge of positive energy washes through a creature. It regains 70 hit points. This spell also ends blindness, deafness, and any diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the healing increases by 10 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Heroes' Feast
components: V, S, M (a gem-encrusted bowl worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You bring forth a magnificent feast that takes 1 hour to consume. Up to twelve creatures can partake. Benefits last for 24 hours: cured of all diseases and poison; immunity to poison and being frightened; advantage on Wisdom saves; and hit point maximum increases by 2d10 (current HP also increases by that amount).

name: Investiture of Flame
description: Flames race across your body. You are immune to fire damage and have resistance to cold damage. Any creature that moves within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there takes 1d10 fire damage. You can use your action to create a line of fire 15 feet long and 5 feet wide; each creature in the line must make a Dexterity save or take 4d8 fire damage.

name: Investiture of Ice
description: Until the spell ends, ice rimes your body. You are immune to cold damage and have resistance to fire damage. You can move across difficult terrain created by ice or snow without extra movement. The ground in a 10-foot radius around you is icy and difficult terrain. You can use your action to create a 15-foot cone of freezing air; each creature in the cone must make a Constitution save or take 4d6 cold damage.

name: Investiture of Stone
description: Bits of rock spread across your body. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. You can use your action to create a small earthquake in a 15-foot radius centered on you. Other creatures on that ground must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

name: Magic Jar
components: V, S, M (a gem, crystal, or ornamental container worth at least 500 gp)
description: Your soul leaves your body and enters a container. While in the container, you can attempt to possess a humanoid within 100 feet. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or your soul moves into its body. While possessing a body, you use its physical statistics but retain your alignment, mental scores, and class features. If the container or host body is destroyed, you may die or be returned to your original body.

name: Mass Suggestion
components: V, M (a snake's tongue and either a bit of honeycomb or a drop of sweet oil)
description: You suggest a course of activity to up to twelve creatures. The suggestion must be reasonable and phrased in a few sentences. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action for the duration or until it completes the task. Asking a creature to perform an obviously harmful act ends the spell for it.
higher_levels: When cast using a 7th-level slot, duration is 10 days. 8th-level, 30 days. 9th-level, a year and a day.

name: Mental Prison
description: You attempt to bind a creature within an illusory cell only it perceives. The target must make an Intelligence save. On success, it takes 5d10 psychic damage and the spell ends. On failure, it takes the damage and is restrained. The target can't see or hear outside the cell. If it moves out, makes a melee attack through it, or reaches through, it takes 10d10 psychic damage and the spell ends.

name: Move Earth
components: V, S, M (an iron blade and a small bag containing a mixture of soils)
description: You choose an area of terrain (up to 40 feet square) and reshape dirt, sand, or clay. You can raise or lower the elevation, create trenches, or change the slope. This spell can't manipulate stone or stone structures. Changes happen slowly over the course of minutes. This spell doesn't have enough force to trap or injure creatures.

name: Otiluke's Freezing Sphere
components: V, S, M (a small crystal sphere)
description: A frigid globe of cold energy streaks from your fingertips to a point of your choice within range, where it explodes in a 60-foot-radius sphere. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d6 cold damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. If the globe strikes a body of water or a liquid that is principally water, it freezes the liquid to a depth of 6 inches over an area 30 feet square. This ice lasts for 1 minute. You can also choose to withhold the explosion, creating a small globe that can be thrown or set down to explode after 1 minute.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Otto's Irresistible Dance
description: Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target begins a comic dance in place: shuffling, tapping its feet, and capering for the duration. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this spell. A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls. While the target is affected, other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it. As an action, a dancing creature makes a Wisdom saving throw to regain control of itself.

name: Planar Ally
description: You beseech an otherworldly entity for aid. The being must be known to you: a god, a primordial, a demon prince, or some other being of cosmic power. That entity sends a celestial, an elemental, or a fiend loyal to it to aid you, making the creature appear in an unoccupied space within range. The creature is under no compulsion to behave in any particular way, and you must negotiate with it to perform a task in exchange for payment.

name: Primordial Ward
description: You have resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage for the spell's duration. When you take damage of one of those types, you can use your reaction to gain immunity to that type of damage, including against the triggering damage. If you do so, the resistances end, and you have the immunity until the end of your next turn, at which time the spell ends.

name: Programmed Illusion
components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece and jade dust worth at least 25 gp)
description: You create an illusion of an object, creature, or phenomenon within range that activates when a specific condition occurs. The illusion must be no larger than a 30-foot cube. You decide how the illusion behaves and what sounds it makes. This scripted performance can last up to 5 minutes. Once triggered, it cannot be triggered again for 10 minutes. Physical interaction reveals it to be an illusion.

name: Scatter
description: The air quivers around up to five creatures of your choice that you can see within range. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to resist this spell. You teleport each affected target to an unoccupied space that you can see within 120 feet of you. That space must be on the ground or on a floor.

name: Soul Cage
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when a humanoid you can see within 60 feet of you dies
components: V, S, M (a tiny silver cage worth 100 gp)
description: You snatch the soul of a dying humanoid and cage it. While the soul is caged, you can exploit it up to six times to gain one of the following benefits: Steal Life (regain 2d8 HP), Query Soul (ask the soul a question), Borrow Experience (gain advantage on a roll), or Eyes of the Dead (create a sensor to see what the soul saw in life). Once you use a benefit six times, the soul is released.

name: Summon Fiend
components: V, S, M (humanoid blood inside a ruby vial worth at least 600 gp)
description: You call forth a fiendish spirit that manifests in an unoccupied space within range. Choose Demon, Devil, or Yugoloth, which determines the creature's traits in its stat block. The creature is an ally and obeys your verbal commands. It shares your initiative count but takes its turn immediately after yours. If the spirit drops to 0 HP or the spell ends, it disappears.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

name: Sunbeam
description: A beam of brilliant light flashes from your hand in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 radiant damage and is blinded until your next turn. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't blinded. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this save. You can create a new line as an action on subsequent turns while the spell lasts.

name: Tasha's Otherworldly Guise
components: V, S, M (an object engraved with a symbol of the Outer Planes worth at least 500 gp)
description: You draw on the magic of the Lower or Upper Planes to transform yourself. You gain: immunity to fire and poison (Lower) or radiant and necrotic (Upper); immunity to the poisoned (Lower) or charmed (Upper) condition; spectral wings with a 40-foot flying speed; a +2 bonus to AC; and all your weapon attacks become magical. You can also attack twice whenever you take the Attack action.

name: Tenser's Transformation
components: V, S, M (a few hairs from a bull)
description: You endow yourself with endurance and martial prowess. You gain 50 temporary hit points, and you have advantage on melee weapon attack rolls. When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you deal an extra 2d12 force damage. You also gain proficiency with all armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons. You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action.

name: Transport via Plants
description: This spell creates a magical link between a Large or larger inanimate plant within range and another plant of the same kind at any distance on the same plane. You must have seen or touched the destination plant at least once. For the duration, any creature can step into the target plant and exit from the destination plant by using 5 feet of movement.

name: True Seeing
components: V, S, M (an ointment for the eyes worth 25 gp, which is consumed)
description: This spell gives a willing creature the ability to see things as they actually are. For the duration, the creature has truesight, notices secret doors hidden by magic, and can see into the Ethereal Plane, all out to a range of 120 feet.

name: Wall of Ice
components: V, S, M (a small piece of quartz)
description: You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. The wall consists of ten 10-foot-square panels or a dome/sphere with a 10-foot radius. If the wall cuts through a creature's space, that creature must make a Dexterity save or take 10d6 cold damage. The wall has AC 12 and 30 HP per panel and is vulnerable to fire. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind frigid air that deals 5d6 cold damage to creatures passing through it.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 2d6 and the frigid air damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Wall of Thorns
components: V, S, M (a handful of thorns)
description: You create a wall of tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a 20-foot diameter circle. The wall blocks line of sight. When it appears, creatures in its area take 7d8 slashing damage on a failed Dexterity save. Moving through the wall costs 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot and causes further slashing damage.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, both types of damage increase by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Wind Walk
components: V, S, M (fire and holy water)
description: You and up to ten willing creatures assume a gaseous form, appearing as wisps of cloud. While in cloud form, a creature has a flying speed of 300 feet and resistance to nonmagical damage. The only actions a creature can take are Dash or to revert to its normal form, which takes 1 minute.

name: Word of Recall
description: You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location linked to your deity. If you cast this spell without a sanctuary, it has no effect.

name: Conjure Celestial
description: You summon a celestial of challenge rating 4 or lower in an unoccupied space within range. The celestial is friendly and obeys your verbal commands. It disappears when it drops to 0 HP or when the spell ends.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, you summon a celestial of challenge rating 5 or lower.

name: Crown of Stars
description: Seven star-like motes appear and orbit your head. You can use a bonus action to send one mote toward a target within 120 feet, making a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 4d12 radiant damage. The motes shed bright light in a 30-foot radius while you have four or more remaining.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of motes increases by two for each slot level above 7th.

name: Delayed Blast Fireball
components: V, S, M (a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur)
description: A yellow beam condenses into a glowing bead at a chosen point. When the spell ends, the bead explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity save, taking fire damage equal to the total accumulated damage. The base damage is 12d6, and it increases by 1d6 for every turn the bead persists. If the bead is touched before detonating, it might explode early.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the base damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 7th.

name: Divine Word
description: You utter a divine word imbued with primordial power. Each creature of your choice within range that can hear you must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, a creature suffers an effect based on its current hit points, ranging from being deafened (50 HP or fewer) to being killed instantly (20 HP or fewer). Celestials, elementals, fey, and fiends that fail are forced back to their home plane.

name: Draconic Transformation
components: V, S, M (a statuette of a dragon worth at least 500 gp)
description: You draw on the magic of dragons to transform. You gain: blindsight (30 feet); a flying speed of 60 feet; and a Breath Weapon. As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can exhale a 60-foot cone of energy, dealing 6d8 force damage to creatures that fail a Dexterity saving throw.

name: Dream of the Blue Veil
components: V, S, M (a magic item or willing creature from the destination world)
description: You and up to eight willing creatures fall unconscious and experience visions of another world on the Material Plane. If the spell reaches its full duration, you are all transported to that world. You must have an item or person from that world to cast the spell.

name: Etherealness
description: You step into the Border Ethereal where it overlaps your current plane. You remain there for the duration or until you dismiss the spell. You can move in any direction and can see the plane you originated from as if it were gray and translucent. You can only affect or be affected by other creatures in the Ethereal Plane.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can target up to three willing creatures for each slot level above 7th.

name: Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting
components: V, S, M (a bit of sponge)
description: You draw the moisture from every creature in a 30-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 12d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Constructs and undead aren't affected, and plants and water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage. Nonmagical plants in the area that aren't creatures, such as trees and shrubs, wither and die instantly.

name: Animal Shapes
description: Your magic transforms up to ten willing creatures you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature can't be affected. The transformation lasts for the duration for each target, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. You can choose a different form for each target. A target's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast, though the target retains its alignment and mental scores. The target assumes the hit points of its new form, and when it reverts, it returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed.

name: Antimagic Field
components: V, S, M (a pinch of powdered iron or iron filings)
description: A 10-foot-radius invisible sphere of antimagic surrounds you. This area is divorced from the magical energy that suffuses the multiverse. Within the sphere, spells can't be cast, summoned creatures disappear, and even magic items become mundane. Spells and other magical effects, except those created by an artifact or a deity, are suppressed in the sphere and can't protrude into it. Targeted effects such as magic missile and charm person have no effect on targets in the sphere.

name: Antipathy/Sympathy
components: V, S, M (lump of alum soaked in vinegar or a drop of honey)
description: This spell attracts or repels creatures of your choice. You target a Huge or smaller object or creature or an area no larger than a 200-foot cube. Specify a kind of intelligent creature, such as red dragons or goblins. Antipathy causes creatures of the specified kind to feel an intense urge to leave the area and avoid the target. Sympathy causes the specified creatures to feel an intense urge to approach the target while within 60 feet of it or able to see it.

name: Clone
components: V, S, M (a diamond worth 1,000 gp and 1 cubic inch of flesh, consumed, and a vessel worth 2,000 gp)
description: This spell grows an inert duplicate of a living creature as a safeguard against death. This clone forms inside a sealed vessel and grows to full size and maturity after 120 days. It remains inert and endures indefinitely as long as its vessel remains undisturbed. If the original creature dies, its soul transfers to the clone, provided the soul is free and willing to return. The clone is physically identical to the original and has the same personality and memories.

name: Control Weather
components: V, S, M (burning incense and bits of earth and wood mixed in water)
description: You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell. Moving to a place where you don't have a clear view of the sky ends the spell early. When you cast the spell, you change the current conditions, which take 1d4 x 10 minutes to become fully effective. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind.

name: Demiplane
description: You create a shadowy door on a flat solid surface that you can see within range. The door is large enough to allow Medium creatures to pass through unhindered. When opened, the door leads to a demiplane that appears to be an empty room 30 feet in each dimension, made of wood or stone. When the spell ends, the door disappears, and any creatures or objects inside remain trapped. You can connect the door to a demiplane you created previously or one whose nature and contents you know.

name: Dominate Monster
description: You attempt to beguile a creature that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. While the creature is charmed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey.
higher_levels: When cast with a 9th-level slot, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.

name: Earthquake
components: V, S, M (a pinch of dirt, a piece of rock, and a lump of clay)
description: You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point. The ground becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a Constitution saving throw or lose concentration. When you cast the spell and at the end of each turn, each creature on the ground must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

name: Feeblemind
components: V, S, M (a handful of clay, crystal, glass, or mineral spheres)
description: You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range, attempting to shatter its intellect and personality. The target takes 4d6 psychic damage and must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw.

name: Forcecage
components: V, S, M (ruby dust worth 1,500 gp)
description: An immobile, invisible, cube-shaped prison of force springs into existence around an area you choose. The prison can be a cage (up to 20 feet on a side with bars) or a solid box (up to 10 feet on a side). Any creature completely inside the area is trapped. Creatures too large or partially within are pushed outside. A creature inside can't leave by nonmagical means. Teleportation or interplanar travel requires a Charisma saving throw to exit. This spell can't be dispelled by dispel magic.

name: Mirage Arcane
description: You make terrain in an area up to 1 mile square look, sound, smell, and feel like some other sort of terrain. Open fields can become a swamp or road. Structures can be altered or added. It does not disguise or add creatures. The illusion includes tactile and olfactory elements and can turn clear ground into difficult terrain. Creatures with truesight see through the illusion to the true form, but all other elements remain.

name: Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion
components: V, S, M (a miniature ivory portal, polished marble, and a tiny silver spoon worth 5 gp)
description: You conjure an extradimensional dwelling with one 5-foot by 10-foot entrance. You choose where the entrance is located and who can enter. Beyond the entrance is a magnificent foyer and numerous chambers up to 50 cubes (10 feet each). It is decorated as you choose and contains enough food to serve a nine-course banquet for 100 people. A staff of 100 near-transparent, obedient servants attends to guests but cannot attack.

name: Mordenkainen's Sword
components: V, S, M (a miniature platinum sword worth 250 gp)
description: You create a sword-shaped plane of force that hovers within range. When the sword appears, you make a melee spell attack against a target within 5 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 force damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the sword up to 20 feet and repeat this attack.

name: Plane Shift
components: V, S, M (a forked metal rod worth 250 gp attuned to a specific plane)
description: You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a destination in general terms. Alternatively, if you know a sigil sequence, the spell can take you to that teleportation circle. You can also use this spell to banish an unwilling creature. Make a melee spell attack; on a hit, the target must make a Charisma saving throw or be sent to a random location on the specified plane.

name: Power Word: Pain
description: You speak a word of power that causes waves of intense pain to assail one creature you can see. If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, it is subject to crippling pain. Otherwise, the spell has no effect. A target is also unaffected if it is immune to being charmed. While affected, the target's speed can't exceed 10 feet, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws (other than Constitution).

name: Prismatic Spray
description: Eight multicolored rays of light flash from your hand. Each target in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a d8 to determine which color ray affects it. Effects range from 10d6 damage (fire, acid, lightning, poison, or cold) to being restrained/petrified, blinded, or transported to another plane. A roll of 8 means the target is struck by two rays.

name: Regenerate
components: V, S, M (a prayer wheel and holy water)
description: You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. The target regains 4d8 + 15 hit points. For the duration, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns. Severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, etc.) are restored after 2 minutes. If you hold the severed part to the stump, the spell causes the limb to knit instantaneously.

name: Resurrection
components: V, S, M (a diamond worth 1,000 gp, consumed)
description: You touch a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century and didn't die of old age. If its soul is free and willing, the target returns to life with all its hit points. The spell neutralizes poisons, cures normal diseases, and restores missing body parts. Coming back is an ordeal: the target takes a -4 penalty to all rolls, which reduces by 1 after each long rest. Restoring someone dead for a year or more prevents you from casting spells and gives you disadvantage on rolls until you finish a long rest.

name: Reverse Gravity
components: V, S, M (a lodestone and iron filings)
description: This spell reverses gravity in a 50-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on a point. Creatures and objects not anchored fall upward to the top of the area. A creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to grab a fixed object to avoid the fall. If a solid object like a ceiling is encountered, falling objects/creatures strike it. At the end of the duration, they fall back down.

name: Sequester
components: V, S, M (powdered diamond, emerald, ruby, and sapphire worth 5,000 gp, consumed)
description: You hide a willing creature or an object, safe from detection. The target becomes invisible and can't be targeted by divination or perceived through scrying sensors. If it is a creature, it falls into suspended animation; time ceases to flow for it and it doesn't age. You can set a condition for the spell to end early, which must occur within 1 mile. The spell also ends if the target takes damage.

name: Simulacrum
components: V, S, M (snow or ice worth 1,500 gp and hair/flesh of the original, consumed)
description: You shape an illusory duplicate of one beast or humanoid within range. The duplicate is a creature partially real and formed from ice or snow. It has half the original's hit point maximum and no equipment. It obeys your spoken commands. It lacks the ability to learn or become more powerful; it never increases in level and cannot regain spell slots. If you cast this spell again, any currently active duplicate is destroyed.

name: Symbol
components: V, S, M (mercury, phosphorus, and diamond/opal dust worth 1,000 gp, consumed)
description: You inscribe a harmful glyph on a surface or inside a closeable object. You decide the trigger. When triggered, the glyph fills a 60-foot-radius sphere with dim light for 10 minutes. Each creature in the sphere is targeted by one of the following chosen effects: Death (10d10 necrotic damage), Discord (bickering for 1 minute), Fear (frightened for 1 minute), Hopelessness (dread for 1 minute), Insanity (confusion for 1 minute), Pain (incapacitated for 1 minute), Sleep (unconscious for 10 minutes), or Stunning (stunned for 1 minute).

name: Teleport
description: This spell instantly transports you and up to eight willing creatures you can see, or a single object fitting in a 10-foot cube, to a destination you select. The destination must be on the same plane. Accuracy is determined by your familiarity with the location: a mismatch can cause a mishap (3d10 force damage) or deposit you in a similar area.

name: Temple of the Gods
components: V, S, M (a holy symbol worth 5 gp)
description: You cause a temple to shimmer into existence on ground you can see, fitting in a 120-foot cube. It is dedicated to your deity or philosophy. You make all decisions about appearance. Only creatures you designate can open the door. Divination sensors can't appear inside, and creatures inside can't be targeted by divination. Creatures in the temple regain extra hit points from healing spells. The temple is made of opaque magical force and ethereal travel into it is blocked.

name: Whirlwind
description: A whirlwind howls down to a point on the ground. It is a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder. Creatures entering or in the area must make a Strength save or take 10d6 bludgeoning damage and be restrained. You can use an action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet. Creatures inside must save or take damage again. A restrained creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check to escape; if successful, it is hurled 3d6 x 10 feet away.

name: Holy Aura
components: V, S, M (a tiny reliquary worth at least 1,000 gp containing a sacred relic)
description: Divine light washes out from you and coalesces in a soft radiance in a 30-foot radius around you. Creatures of your choice in that radius shed dim light in a 5-foot radius and have advantage on all saving throws, and other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against them until the spell ends. In addition, when a fiend or an undead hits an affected creature with a melee attack, the aura flashes with brilliant light. The attacker must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the spell ends.

name: Illusory Dragon
description: By gathering shadow material from the Shadowfell, you create a Huge shadowy dragon in an unoccupied space within range. The illusion is tangible, though attacks miss it automatically. When it appears, enemies that can see it must succeed on a Wisdom save or be frightened. As a bonus action, you can move the dragon 60 feet and have it exhale energy (acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or poison) in a 60-foot cone, dealing 7d6 damage on a failed Intelligence save (half on success).

name: Incendiary Cloud
description: A swirling cloud of smoke shot through with white-hot embers appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere. The cloud spreads around corners and its area is heavily obscured. When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity save, taking 10d8 fire damage on a failure (half on success). A creature must also save when it enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The cloud moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns.

name: Maddening Darkness
components: V, M (a drop of pitch mixed with a drop of mercury)
description: Magical darkness spreads from a point to fill a 60-foot-radius sphere. It spreads around corners and foils darkvision. Shrieks and mad laughter echo within. Whenever a creature starts its turn in the sphere, it must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 8d8 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

name: Maze
description: You banish a creature into a labyrinthine demiplane. The target remains there for the duration or until it escapes. The target can use its action to attempt a DC 20 Intelligence check to escape; it succeeds automatically if it is a minotaur or goristro. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or the nearest unoccupied space.

name: Mighty Fortress
components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 500 gp)
description: A stone fortress erupts from a 120-foot square area. It includes four 30-foot turrets, connected walls, and a small keep with three floors. It is furnished, contains food for a banquet of 100 people, and is staffed by 100 invisible servants. After 7 days, it crumbles unless cast again in the same spot every 7 days for a year, which makes it permanent.

name: Mind Blank
description: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is immune to psychic damage, any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, divination spells, and the charmed condition. The spell even foils wish spells or similar effects used to affect the target's mind.

name: Power Word: Stun
description: You speak a word of power that can overwhelm the mind of one creature you can see within range. If the target has 150 hit points or fewer, it is stunned. The stunned target must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns; on a success, the effect ends.

name: Sunburst
components: V, S, M (fire and a piece of sunstone)
description: Brilliant sunlight flashes in a 60-foot radius. Each creature in that light must make a Constitution save. On failure, a target takes 12d6 radiant damage and is blinded for 1 minute (half damage and no blindness on success). Undead and oozes have disadvantage on the save. Blinded creatures can repeat the save at the end of their turns. This spell dispels magical darkness in its area.

name: Telepathy
components: V, S, M (a pair of linked silver rings)
description: You create a telepathic link with a willing creature you are familiar with on the same plane. Until the spell ends, you can instantaneously share words, images, sounds, and other sensory messages. The target recognizes you as the communicator and can understand your words if its Intelligence is at least 1.

name: Tsunami
description: A wall of water up to 300 feet long, 300 feet high, and 50 feet thick appears. When it appears, creatures within take 6d10 bludgeoning damage (Strength save for half). At the start of each of your turns, the wall moves 50 feet away from you. Any creature the wall moves over or that is inside it must make a Strength save or take damage and be caught. The damage decreases by 1d10 each round.
higher_levels: Does not increase the wall's health when frozen or the damage reduction against fire.

name: Astral Projection
components: V, S, M (for each target, a jacinth worth 1,000 gp and a silver bar worth 100 gp)
description: You and up to eight willing creatures project astral bodies into the Astral Plane. Your material bodies are in suspended animation. The astral body is a separate incarnation; damage to it does not affect the material body. The spell ends if the silver cord is cut (causing death), the material body dies, or you dismiss it. You can travel to other planes from the Astral, at which point the spell ends for those targets as they enter the new plane.

name: Blade of Disaster
description: You create a blade-shaped planar rift. You can make up to two melee spell attacks with it. On a hit, it deals 4d12 force damage. It scores a critical hit on an 18-20, dealing an extra 8d12 force damage (12d12 total). As a bonus action, you can move it up to 30 feet and repeat the attacks. It can pass through any barrier, including a wall of force.

name: Foresight
description: You touch a willing creature and grant it a limited ability to see into the immediate future. For the duration, the target can't be surprised and has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Additionally, other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target.

name: Gate
components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 5,000 gp)
description: You conjure a portal linking a space you see to a precise location on a different plane. The portal is a circular opening 5 to 20 feet in diameter. Travel is possible through the front. You can speak the name of a specific creature to open the portal in its vicinity and draw it through. Deities or planar rulers can prevent this portal from opening in their domain.

name: Imprisonment
components: V, S, M (a vellum depiction or carved statuette of the target and special materials worth 500 gp per Hit Die)
description: You create a magical restraint. The target must succeed on a Wisdom save or be bound. Choose Burial, Chaining, Hedged Prison, Minimus Containment, or Slumber. The creature doesn't age and doesn't need to eat. You can specify a release condition during casting. A 9th-level dispel magic can end the spell only if targeted at the prison or special component.

name: Invulnerability
components: V, S, M (adamantine worth at least 500 gp, which is consumed)
description: You are immune to all damage until the spell ends.

name: Mass Heal
description: A flood of healing energy flows from you. You restore up to 700 hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures within range. Creatures healed are also cured of all diseases and the blinded/deafened conditions. This has no effect on undead or constructs.

name: Mass Polymorph
description: You transform up to ten creatures you see. Unwilling targets must succeed on a Wisdom save. Each target assumes a beast form of your choice (CR equal to or less than target's CR or half level). Targets gain temporary hit points equal to the new form's HP. The target's gear melds and it cannot speak or cast spells in the new form.

name: Meteor Swarm
description: Blazing orbs plummet at four points you choose. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere must make a Dexterity save, taking 20d6 fire and 20d6 bludgeoning damage (half on success). Damage to objects is severe, and flammable objects are ignited.

name: Power Word Heal
description: Healing energy washes over a creature you touch. The target regains all hit points. Conditions like charmed, frightened, paralyzed, or stunned end, and the target can use its reaction to stand up if it is prone.

name: Power Word Kill
description: You utter a word of power. If the creature you choose has 100 hit points or fewer, it dies instantly. Otherwise, the spell has no effect.

name: Prismatic Wall
description: A shimmering multicolored wall (90ft long/30ft high or 30ft sphere) appears. It consists of seven layers, each dealing 10d6 damage of a specific type or a condition on a failed Dexterity save. Each layer must be destroyed in order (Red to Violet) by specific damage or spells. It provides total cover and blinds creatures within 20 feet for 1 minute on a failed Constitution save.

name: Psychic Scream
description: You unleash the power of your mind to blast the intellect of up to ten creatures. Targets must make an Intelligence save. On failure, they take 14d6 psychic damage and are stunned. If killed, their head explodes. Stunned targets repeat the save at the end of their turns.

name: Shapechange
components: V, S, M (a jade circlet worth at least 1,500 gp)
description: You transform into a creature with CR equal to or less than your level. You retain your alignment and mental scores. You assume the form's physical statistics and hit points. You can't use legendary or lair actions. You can change into a different form as an action during the duration.

name: Storm of Vengeance
description: A churning storm cloud forms. Effects occur each round: 2d6 thunder damage/deafened (Con save); acid rain (1d6 damage); 6 lightning bolts (10d6 damage each); 2d6 cold damage; freezing rain (difficult terrain). On the final rounds, creatures take 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

name: Time Stop
description: You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. You take 1d4 + 1 turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal. The spell ends if any of your actions affect another creature or an object worn/carried by someone else.

name: True Polymorph
components: V, S, M (a drop of mercury, a dollop of gum arabic, and a wisp of smoke)
description: You transform a creature or object into a different form. Unwilling targets make a Wisdom save. Transformation lasts the duration, but if you concentrate for the full hour, it becomes permanent. You can turn creature into creature, object into creature, or creature into object.

name: True Resurrection
components: V, S, M (diamonds worth at least 25,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You touch a dead creature (dead up to 200 years) and it returns to life with all hit points. It replaces damaged/missing organs and limbs. It can provide a new body if the original is gone. Undead are returned to their living form.

name: Weird
description: You create illusory creatures in the minds of targets in a 30-foot-radius sphere. Targets must make a Wisdom save or be frightened. At the start of each of their turns, they must repeat the save or take 4d10 psychic damage; success ends the effect on that creature.

name: Wish
description: Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal can cast. The basic use is to duplicate any spell of 8th level or lower. Alternatively, you can create objects, heal allies, grant resistance/immunity, or undo recent events. Using it for anything other than spell duplication causes severe stress, potentially preventing you from ever casting wish again.

name: Air Bubble
description: You create a globe of fresh air around the head of a willing creature or object within range. The globe grants the creature the ability to breathe in environments where they otherwise couldn't and lasts for the duration.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can create two additional bubbles for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Borrowed Knowledge
components: V, S, M (a book worth at least 25 gp)
description: You draw on the knowledge of spirits past. You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice which lasts until the spell ends.

name: Arcane Weapon (UA)
description: You channel lethal energy into a weapon youâ€™re holding. Choose one damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 damage of the chosen type to any target you hit with the weapon.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours.

name: Frost Fingers
description: Freezing cold blasts from your fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 cold damage and has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. On a success, it takes half damage.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Finger of Death
description: You send negative energy coursing through a creature that you can see within range, causing it searing pain. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes 7d8 + 30 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A humanoid killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a zombie that is permanently under your command.

name: Galder's Speedy Courier
components: V, S, M (a piece of parchment and a gold coin)
description: You summon a Small air elemental to serve as a courier. You provide the courier with an object and a recipient. The courier flies toward the recipient to deliver the item. If the recipient is on another plane, the courier disappears and the item is lost.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level slot or higher, the courier can carry one additional object for each slot level above 4th.

name: Galder's Tower
components: V, S, M (a fragment of stone, wood, or brick)
description: You conjure a two-story tower on the ground in an unoccupied space. The tower can include a bedroom, study, or dining room. If you cast this spell every day for a year in the same location, the tower becomes permanent.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the tower can have one additional story for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Gift of Gab
casting_time: 1 reaction (which you take when you speak to another creature)
components: V, S, M (a gold coin worth at least 2 gp)
description: You can Reshape the memories of listeners in your immediate vicinity. Any creatures within 5 feet of you that heard you speak within the last 6 seconds forget your words and instead remember you saying something else of your choice.

name: Gravity Sinkhole
components: V, S, M (a tiny black marble)
description: A 20-foot-radius sphere of crushing force forms at a point you choose. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 5d10 force damage and is pulled toward the center. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't pulled.
higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 4th.

name: Invisibility to Cameras (UA)
components: V, S, M (a scrap of black silk)
description: You become invisible to electronic sensors and cameras. You can still be seen by the naked eye.

name: Jim's Magic Missile
components: V, S, M (a gold coin worth at least 1 gp)
description: You create three glowing darts. Make a ranged spell attack for each. On a hit, a dart deals 2d4 force damage. If you roll a 1 on the attack, the dart blows up in your face, dealing 1 force damage and ending the spell.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

name: Kinetic Jaunt
description: Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you don't provoke opportunity attacks. You can move through the space of another creature, though you cannot end your turn there.

name: Motivational Speech
description: You deliver a speech that strengthens up to five creatures. Each gains 5 temporary hit points and advantage on Wisdom saves. If the temporary hit points are lost, the advantage on Wisdom saves is also lost.
higher_levels: The temporary hit points increase by 5 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: On/Off (UA)
description: This cantrip allows you to activate or deactivate an electronic device within range that could be flipped on or off with a switch, such as a lamp, a computer, or a television.

name: Otherworldly Form (UA)
components: V, S, M (an object engraved with a symbol of the Outer Planes worth 500 gp)
description: You call upon the power of the Outer Planes to transform. Choose Celestial or Fiendish. You gain wings (40 ft. fly speed), +2 bonus to AC, immunity to certain damage types (Radiant/Necrotic or Fire/Poison), and your weapon attacks deal extra damage.

name: Project Image
components: V, S, M (a small replica of yourself worth 5 gp)
description: You create an illusory copy of yourself that lasts for the duration. The copy can appear at any location you have seen before within range. You can see through its eyes and hear through its ears as if you were in its space.

name: Psionic Blast (UA)
description: You unleash a wave of telescopic force. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 force damage and is knocked prone. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't knocked prone.
higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Ravenous Void
components: V, S, M (a tiny dead star worth at least 1,000 gp)
description: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of gravitational force. Any creature within 100 feet of the sphere is pulled toward it. Creatures inside the sphere take 5d10 force damage at the start of their turn and are restrained.

name: Silvery Barbs
casting_time: 1 reaction (when a creature you can see succeeds on an attack, save, or check)
description: The triggering creature must reroll the d20 and use the lower roll. You then choose a different creature you can see within range (including yourself). That creature has advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes within 1 minute.

name: Sudden Awakening (UA)
description: Each sleeping creature you choose within range awakens, and then can stand up without expending any movement.

name: Protection from Ballistics (UA)
description: This spell enchants the flesh of a willing creature you touch, granting it resistance to nonmagical ballistic damage (damage from firearms).

name: Psychic Crush (UA)
description: You overload the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 12d6 psychic damage and is stunned for 1 minute. On a success, it takes half damage and isn't stunned.

name: Puppet (UA)
description: Your gesture forces a creature to make a Constitution save. On a failure, you choose a direction, and the target must use its reaction to move its speed in that direction. You can also cause it to drop whatever it is holding.

name: Raulothim's Psychic Lance (UA)
description: You unleash a shimmering lance of psychic energy. You can name a specific creature; if it is within range, it is targeted even if you can't see it. The target must make an Intelligence save or take 7d6 psychic damage and be incapacitated until the start of your next turn.
higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

name: Reality Break
description: You shatter the reality of a creature you can see. The target must make a Wisdom save. On a failure, it takes 10d12 psychic damage and is restrained as it experiences multiple timelines. It must repeat the save at the start of its turns.

name: Remote Access (UA)
description: You can use any electronic device within range as if you were standing directly in front of it. This includes computers, keypad locks, and cameras.

name: Sense Emotion (UA)
description: You sense the emotional state of one creature you can see within 30 feet. You learn if it is happy, sad, angry, or frightened, and gain advantage on Charisma checks against it.

name: Shutdown (UA)
description: All electronic devices within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose cease to function for the duration. Batteries are drained and machines stop.

name: Spirit of Death (UA)
components: V, S, M (a gilded skull worth 300 gp)
description: You summon a spirit that manifests as a Reaper in an unoccupied space. It is friendly to you and your allies and takes its turn immediately after yours. It disappears when it drops to 0 HP or the spell ends.
higher_levels: The spirit's AC and damage increase when you use a higher level spell slot.

name: Spray of Cards
components: V, S, M (a deck of cards)
description: You spray a flurry of magical cards. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity save. On a failure, a creature takes 2d10 force damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a success, it takes half damage.
higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Summon Draconic Spirit (UA)
components: V, S, M (an object engraved with a dragon worth 500 gp)
description: You call forth a draconic spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Draconic Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a family: Chromatic, Gem, or Metallic. The creature resembles a dragon of that family, which determines certain traits in its stat block.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

name: Summon Warrior Spirit (UA)
components: V, S, M (a piece of a fallen warrior's equipment)
description: You call forth the spirit of a great warrior. It manifests as a corporeal figure in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. Choose its origin: Monk, Rogue, or Fighter. The spirit disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.
higher_levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

name: Synchronicity (UA)
description: The target you touch has its path cleared by incredible coincidence. For the duration, the target cannot be surprised, has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

name: System Backdoor (UA)
description: You find a digital 'backdoor' in a computer system or electronic lock, giving you administrative access. You gain advantage on all checks made to hack or control the system for the duration.

name: Temporal Shunt
casting_time: 1 reaction (taken when a creature you see makes an attack or starts to cast a spell)
description: You target the triggering creature, which must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or vanish, being thrown a split second into the future. The target disappears, and the triggering attack or spell automatically misses/fails. The target reappears at the start of its next turn.
higher_levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

name: Tether Essence
components: V, S, M (a spool of platinum cord worth 250 gp)
description: Two creatures you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw. If both fail, they are tethered. Whenever one takes damage, the other takes an equal amount of damage of the same type. Healing is similarly shared.

name: Thought Shield (UA)
description: You touch a willing creature and shield its mind. For the duration, the target's thoughts cannot be read by any means unless it allows it, and the target has resistance to psychic damage.

name: Time Ravage
components: V, S, M (an hourglass filled with diamond dust worth 5,000 gp)
description: You target a creature you can see. It must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes 10d12 necrotic damage and rapidly ages to the end of its lifespan. Within 30 days, it dies of old age. On a success, it takes half damage and does not age.

name: Unearthly Chorus (UA)
description: Music of the feywild fills the air. You gain advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to force a creature to make a Wisdom save or be charmed until the start of your next turn.

name: Virtue (UA)
description: You touch one creature, imparting a tiny bolster to its life force. The creature gains temporary hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. These temporary hit points vanish at the start of your next turn.

name: Vortex Warp
description: You attempt to teleport a creature to an unoccupied space you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be teleported. The chosen space must be on a surface or in a liquid that can support the creature.
higher_levels: The range increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Warp Sense
components: V, S, M (a small loop of gold wire)
description: You sense the presence of any teleportation or planar travel that occurs within 300 feet of you. You know the location of the origin and destination points.

name: Wild Cunning (UA)
description: You call upon your link to nature to immediately learn the location of the nearest potable water, edible food, and safe shelter within range.

name: Wither and Bloom
components: V, S, M (a withered vine twisted into a loop)
description: You invoke both death and life. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere must make a Constitution save or take 2d6 necrotic damage. Additionally, one creature of your choice in that area can spend one of its unspent Hit Dice to regain hit points.
higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Wristpocket
description: You flick your wrist and cause one object you are holding (weighing no more than 5 lbs) to vanish into an extra-dimensional space. While the object is there, it is invisible. You can use an action to make it reappear in your hand.

name: Spray of Cards (UA)
components: V, S, M (a deck of cards)
description: You spray a flurry of magical cards. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity save. On a failure, a creature takes 2d10 force damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a success, it takes half damage.
higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.
